text: Bird City is a city in Cheyenne County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 437 people lived there. ==History== Bird City was created in 1885. It was named after Benjamin Bird, a cattleman. The area around the city was originally used for livestock grazing. Bird City was a station and shipping point on the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy Railroad. ==Geography== Bird City is at (39.749514, -101.532765). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ==Weather== The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Bird City has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Bird City, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 437 people, 205 households, and 112 families living in Bird City. Of the households, 66.8% owned their home and 33.2% rented their home. The median age was 47.8 years. Of the people, 81.2% were White, 0.5% were Asian, 7.6% were from some other race, and 10.8% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 17.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 447 people, 211 households, and 118 families living in Bird City. ==Education== Bird City is a part of USD 103 Cheylin. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Bird City * Bird City - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 103, local school district ;Maps * Bird City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:Cheyenne County, Kansas Category:1885 establishments in Kansas
title: Bird City, Kansas
